sentences.sentence: He flew over the top of the church tower where he saw some beautiful angels( 天使 ) made of stone.
He passed by the palace and heard the sound of dancing.
A beautiful girl came out into the garden with her lover.
“How wonderful the stars are,” she said, “and how wonderful is the power of love!”
“I hope my dress will be ready in time for the Queen’s dance,” she thought.
“It has to be perfect, but the woman who is making it is so lazy.”
At last, he came to the poor house and looked in.
The boy was rolling( 翻滚 ) back and forth( 来回地 ) feverishly on his bed,
and the mother had fallen asleep, because she was so tired.
The Swallow( 燕子 ) flew in, and set the great ruby( 红宝石 ) down on the table beside the woman.
Then he flew gently around the bed, fanning( 扇（风） ) the boy with his wings.
“How cool I feel,” said the boy. “I must be getting better.”
Then the boy fell into( 陷入 ) a deep sleep.
The Swallow( 燕子 ) flew back to the Happy Prince( 王子 ), and told him what he had done.
“It is strange,” he said, “but I feel quite warm now, although it is so cold.”
“That is because you have done a good thing,” said the Prince( 王子 ).
The little Swallow( 燕子 ) began to think about what the Happy Prince( 王子 ) had said, and then he fell asleep.
Thinking always made him sleepy.
When the sun rose he flew down to the river and had a swim.
“A swallow( 燕子 ) in winter!” said the professor( 教授 ) as he was passing over the bridge.
“What an unexpected sight!”
And he wrote a long letter about it to the local newspaper.
Everyone talked about it, because it was full of so many words that they could not understand.
“Tonight I am going to Egypt( 埃及，地名 ),” said the Swallow( 燕子 ) to himself, and he began to feel excited.
When the moon rose he flew back to the Happy Prince( 王子 ).
“I am coming to say goodbye to you,” he told the Prince( 王子 ).
“I am leaving for Egypt( 埃及，地名 ).”
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ),
“will you please stay with me for one more night?”
“I have friends waiting for me in Egypt( 埃及，地名 ),” answered the Swallow( 燕子 ).
“Tomorrow they will fly to a great waterfall( 瀑布 ) along the Nile River,
and they will all be expecting me to meet them there soon.”
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ),
“far away across the city, I see a young man in a high window.
His hair is brown and neat( 整齐的 ), and his lips( 嘴唇 ) are red as a rose, and he has large and beautiful eyes.
He is bent( 弯腰的 ) over a desk covered with papers, and trying to finish a play for the director of the theater,
but he is too cold to write any more.
There is no fire in his room, and he has not eaten anything all day.”
“I will stay with you one more night,” said the Swallow( 燕子 ), who really had a good heart.
“Should I take him another ruby( 红宝石 )?”
“I have no ruby( 红宝石 ) now,” said the Prince( 王子 ).
“My eyes are all that I have left.
They are made of precious( 珍稀的 ) sapphires( 蓝宝石 ), which were brought here from India a thousand years ago.
Pull one of them out and take it to him.
He can sell it, buy food and firewood( 木柴 ), and finish his play.”
“Dear Prince( 王子 ),” said the Swallow( 燕子 ), “I cannot do that,”
and the little bird began to cry.
“Swallow( 燕子 ), Swallow( 燕子 ), little Swallow( 燕子 ),” said the Prince( 王子 ), “do as I tell you.”
So the Swallow( 燕子 ) pulled out( 取出 ) the Prince( 王子 )’s eye, and flew away to the young man’s window.
It was easy enough to get in, because there was a hole in the roof( 屋顶 ).
He flew in through the hole, and came into the room.
The young man was holding his head in his hands, so he did not hear the sound of the bird’s wings.
When he looked up he found the beautiful sapphire( 蓝宝石 ) lying on the desk beside him.
“I must have fallen asleep,” the young man said.
“Perhaps somebody liked my work, and brought this to help support me.
Now I can finish my play.” The young man was so happy.

article_info.previous: 燕子到达快乐王子所在的城市，正准备睡下，突然一滴水落在身上，原来是王子的眼泪。于是王子开始向燕子讲述自己在城市里看到的苦难，并请求燕子帮忙。
article_info.share_words: The Swallow flew in, and set the great ruby down on the table beside the woman. Then he flew gently around the bed, fanning the boy with his wings.

question.cn: 燕子为生病的小男孩做了什么？
question.en: What did the Swallow do to the sick boy?

options.en: He fed some water for the boy.

options.cn: 他用自己的翅膀给小男孩扇风。
options.en: He fanned the boy with his wings.

analysis: 文中提到，" then he flew gently around the bed, fanning the boy with his wings"，因此选B。

question.cn: 王子认为为什么燕子会感觉温暖？
question.en: According to the Prince, why did the Swallow feel warm?

options.en: The Swallow did a good thing.

analysis: 文中提到：“That is because you have done a good thing.”快乐王子认为燕子做了一件好事，所以会感觉到温暖，因此选B。

question.cn: 教授看到燕子之后，为什么会写一篇文章？
question.en: Why did the professor write a letter after seeing the Swallow?

options.cn: 在冬天看见燕子很奇怪。
options.en: It was strange to see a Swallow in winter.

options.cn: 他认为这是一只新品种的燕子。
options.en: He thought this was a new kind of Swallow.
He liked the Swallow very much.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘A swallow in winter!’said the professor as he was passing over the bridge. ‘What an unexpected sight!’and he wrote a long letter about it to the local newspaper.”在冬天看到燕子是一个很出乎意料的事情，所以教授写了一篇文章，因此选A。

question.cn: 王子为什么让燕子多呆一晚上？
question.en: Why did the Prince ask the Swallow to stay one more night?

options.en: Because he fell in love with the Swallow.

options.cn: 王子想让燕子把自己的一只眼睛送给贫穷的剧作家。
options.en: He wanted the Swallow to bring one of his eyes to a poor young man.

options.cn: 王子不想再回到孤单的状态。
options.en: He didn't want to be alone again.

analysis: 文中提到：“My eyes are all that I have left...pull one of them out and take it to him.”王子让燕子把自己的一只眼睛送给贫穷的剧作家，帮助他度过难关，因此选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第33天
